bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Librarian, City Library, Indianapolis, Indiana, August 26, 1940

div1.p: Hench requests the Indianapolis newspaper reports about Reed's 1900 American Public Health Association paper.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to the Librarian, City Library, Indianapolis, Indiana, August 26, 1940
div1.opener:
August 26, 1940
Librarian
City Library
Indianapolis, Indiana
Madam:
div1.p:
In the latter part of October, 1900, Major Walter Reed,
the head of the U.S. Army Yellow Fever Board, went from Cuba to Indianapolis
to give his famous “Preliminary Report” before the meeting of the American
Public Health Association in Indianapolis. The dates of the meeting were
October 22 to 26-1900.

I have been asked to read a paper on the conquest of yellow
fever, and to write up the story of this work. I would appreciate very greatly
if you could give me the following help. Could you look through the Indianapolis
newspapers of the dates mentioned above and tell me whether they carried any
reports of Walter Reed's paper, and what their reaction to it was. This was the
first announcement of the discovery of the cause of yellow fever. If there are
any reports of the paper, could you have them photostated for me? I should be
delighted to pay the cost.
div1.closer: Very sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
